author: Sethro3
title: Treehouse of Fun
review:
Elves always adds in some neat places and scenes. I like the addition of new colors to add to the fantasy world. It creates a nice setting for people to get lost in.

PROS:

- Nice sand green pieces. I love the ornate fencing and the roof on the tree house.

- It actually looks like a tree house, other than the lack of foliage. Speaking of which, I love the new purple and lavender colors. It adds a lot of fantasy to these sets.

- The barrel pulley is fun. Quite simple to build, but adds a lot for play value.

CONS:

- I would like it more enclosed. From the front it looks like a nice tree house, but when you turn it around, it feels incomplete.

- Dark red tree is different, but I like the new re-colored pieces.

- The bridge mechanism seems unrealistic. You can use it as a ladder and then push the bar and make it a bridge, but in reality it wouldn't work like that. But it's LEGO, not reality.

- I don't understand the medium azure plate on the right side. It looks like a small waterfall and stream leading into the larger lake, but it feels forced. Maybe if there was dark gray rocks along the sides it would feel more like a stream, but as it is, it is above the grass and doesn't fit right.

OVERALL OPINION:

From a play value standpoint, this is a fun set. I like the features included. I would like to see it fleshed out a bit more with more foliage and more side walls to give it a full tree house feel while still allowing play room from the back. I would recommend picking it up if you can find it. But I know it was in an earlier wave, so supply may be limited.

author: Azure_sea
title: Best elves playset
review:
This set is great for playing with, my six year old cousin received this set for Christmas and played for hours before even opening another present. This set is brilliant for play as you can re-enacting the scene where Emily Jones comes through the portal.

Overall a great set for play and display!
